metadata.title: CVE-2024-0565 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: An out-of-bounds memory read flaw was found in receive_encrypted_standardin fs/smb/client/smb2ops.c in the SMB Client sub-component in the LinuxKernel. This issue occurs due to integer underflow on the memcpy length,leading to a denial of service.

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
